revised_title: An Investigation into the Formation and Origin of the Belemnite Fossil
tldr: The author examines the origin and formation of the Belemnite fossil, a marine creature commonly found in England. He investigates two types of Belemnites and their differences in structure, concluding that they are part of the testaceous family of the nautili. The author also discusses the growth process of these creatures and how they form their shells, drawing on the work of other naturalists like Reaumur and Poupart.
